channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Man, 86, died in Bude Canal saving disabled daughter
item.description: Lawrence Casey's family say "his final act of love" was to "sacrifice his life to save hers".

item.title: Dizzee Rascal: Rapper denies headbutting ex-girlfriend
item.description: The rapper, whose real name is Dylan Mills, is due to go on trial in February next year.

item.title: Man in court after father dies on Birmingham night out
item.description: Matthew Carroll suffered a fatal head injury while with his son and his friends in Birmingham.

item.title: Birmingham dancing thief's 'fancy footwork' caught on camera
item.description: Police describe Abdelhadi Bahou Jabour's moves as "part Bruce Forsyth, part Artful Dodger".

item.title: Leeds to Carlisle trains suspended after bull killed on track
item.description: A train struck and killed a bull near Ribblehead, causing service suspensions.

item.title: Wigan park rape: Teenager arrested after girl attacked
item.description: A girl, 16, was held on suspicion of arranging or facilitating the commission of a child sex offence.

item.title: Leeds Festival: Victim attacked with acid during Post Malone set
item.description: Olly Spencer-Littlewood says he feared he would be scarred for life after the attack.

item.title: FA Youth Cup footballer in hospital after collapse in Nottinghamshire
item.description: The young player was treated with a defibrillator after becoming "seriously unwell".

item.title: Reading stabbings: Bravery awards for police who tackled terrorist
item.description: The officers are honoured for apprehending a man who murdered three people in Reading in June 2020.

item.title: Manchester Arena bomb: Three PCs on duty face internal investigations
item.description: Three officers are to face internal investigations over their actions on the night of the atrocity.

item.title: Austin Mitchell: Funeral of former Grimsby MP takes place in Bradford
item.description: Mourners gather at Saltaire United Reformed Church for the former Labour MP's funeral.

item.title: Decades-old Broadstairs ice cream parlour makes it through 'difficult period'
item.description: Six generations of Morellis have worked at the family's ice cream parlour in Broadstairs, Kent.

item.title: Paralympics: Husband praises 'incredible' Dame Sarah Storey
item.description: Dame Sarah Storey is Great Britain's most successful Paralympian after winning her 17th gold medal.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo superfan relishes Manchester United return
item.description: Dominic Urbani is so obsessed with Cristiano Ronaldo that he studied for a degree in Portuguese.

item.title: 'Wheelyboat gives me freedom out on the water'
item.description: A specially designed boat with wheelchair access is allowing disabled anglers to go fishing.

item.title: Covid shielder gets private opera performance in back garden
item.description: Ceinwen Giles is shielding from Covid due to her cancer treatment, so an opera was brought to her garden.

item.title: Mental Health: The ambulance workers feeding callers
item.description: A Merseyside mental health ambulance team is offering food support for its most in need patients.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton top as Dutch Grand Prix first practice delayed by Vettel car problem
item.description: Lewis Hamilton headed title rival Max Verstappen in a bizarrely truncated first practice session at the Dutch Grand Prix.

item.title: US Open 2021: Emma Raducanu beats Zhang Shuai to reach third round
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu delivers another impressive display as she sweeps aside China's Zhang Shuai to reach the US Open third round.

item.title: Hungary v England: Fifa investigating racial abuse aimed at players at Puskas Arena
item.description: Fifa is investigating racial abuse aimed at England players during Thursday's 4-0 win over Hungary in a World Cup qualifier in Budapest.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Great Britain win more golds and pass the 100-medal mark
item.description: Great Britain win three more golds and pass the 100-medal mark at the Tokyo Paralympics
